post.body:
I'm looking through my feed and Ruqqus content is branching out in more directions, and (dare I say) is becoming more "diverse" in it's content.  

That's good to see.  We want to be a platform for everyone to use and have an enjoyable experience.  I think the first things new users should be told about are the "hide" feature and all other content filtering so they can get straight to what they enjoy and cut out what is less than desirable.  We should really emphasize to the user that they can make the experience their own.

Anyway keep up the good work and go team Ruqqus.

We should really emphasize to the user that they can make the experience their own.

Anyway keep up the good work and go team Ruqqus.

post.title: Ruqqus, what advice would you give to your past self?

author.bio:

author.bio_html:
Goodbye. https://ruqqus.com/+The_Cabal/post/d9y9/i-told-you-so-all-the

Remember: History repeats, and the unaware are doomed to repeat it.

body:
Yeah but my point is it and other similar things tend to be *biased* in favor of selecting mods. I don't think that part is entirely intentional but I think if this goes on for too long without being addressed it will inevitably evolve into a power user/admin cabal similar to what happened on reddit. It's hard to keep talking to the same users all the time and it not become a clique. Limiting people to 10 guilds isn't going to stop the connections and elite networks from forming.

I do think we still quite a bit of time until anything permanent happens. But it's still annoying seeing some users get a ton of special privileges just because cap (it's usually him from what I've seen) decided he liked them better than everyone else. It's one of the things people here are trying to get away from.
body_html:
Yeah but my point is it and other similar things tend to be biased in favor of selecting mods. I don't think that part is entirely intentional but I think if this goes on for too long without being addressed it will inevitably evolve into a power user/admin cabal similar to what happened on reddit. It's hard to keep talking to the same users all the time and it not become a clique. Limiting people to 10 guilds isn't going to stop the connections and elite networks from forming.

I do think we still quite a bit of time until anything permanent happens. But it's still annoying seeing some users get a ton of special privileges just because cap (it's usually him from what I've seen) decided he liked them better than everyone else. It's one of the things people here are trying to get away from.

body: Even if they're not "official" (and I'd argue +BetaFeedback is pretty official) it's not a good sign that you only gm the same people all the time, and every single one of them is also a discord mod and quite a bit of other stuff too. It's a big red flag of bias towards certain users. This is mostly a natural subconscious mechanism and needs to be intentionally curbed or else it will always happen.

* +ruqquspress

body:
You just saw. Everyone else here is easily posting exactly right and they just started months ago, whereas I've been purposely trying for years and still haven't gotten the hang of most of it. That's how my life goes.

I've talked to lots of people and they have no idea what to tell me. Everything just comes to them and clicks. It is not so with me.

body:
Not in this guild they don't. When I post in larger guilds they get more compared to this guild. But just in here, my posts usually don't go above 30 whereas most of the others' fall in the 50-60 range. The only reason I got more today was because I made a post an hour after the other person and pushed theirs down a spot. It still probably won't get as high as their posts normally. And I only posted that because that person told me exactly when to post it, whereas everyone else just figured it out on this own. I created this guild and spent years on /r/EverythingFoxes before that, I should be the most familiar with it and the biggest contributor.

I also have a lot more trouble finding the content in the first place, and making creative titles for them. For example "fluffy roll" vs what I could probably come up with "floof" or "very fluffy fox".

And everything I try to do is like this. It just shows that I fail miserably even at the smallest stuff like this.
body_html:
Not in this guild they don't. When I post in larger guilds they get more compared to this guild. But just in here, my posts usually don't go above 30 whereas most of the others' fall in the 50-60 range. The only reason I got more today was because I made a post an hour after the other person and pushed theirs down a spot. It still probably won't get as high as their posts normally. And I only posted that because that person told me exactly when to post it, whereas everyone else just figured it out on this own. I created this guild and spent years on /r/EverythingFoxes before that, I should be the most familiar with it and the biggest contributor.

I also have a lot more trouble finding the content in the first place, and making creative titles for them. For example "fluffy roll" vs what I could probably come up with "floof" or "very fluffy fox".

And everything I try to do is like this. It just shows that I fail miserably even at the smallest stuff like this.

body:
> Only a few people get more likes, and I don't know why.

I don't know why either, but it's not only a few people. It's everyone who's an active poster, except me.

> I don't think people really sit around timing their posts

I don't either, except me, but they did say that they "got the hang of it" after a short time.

> maybe it's just the name of their posts

Exactly one of my theories:

> I also have a lot more trouble finding the content in the first place, and making creative titles for them. For example "fluffy roll" vs what I could probably come up with "floof" or "very fluffy fox".

The problem is I'm just stupid and a complete mess. I've got nothing together, not even my main goals, and nothing I try works to fix it.
body_html:
Only a few people get more likes, and I don't know why.

I don't know why either, but it's not only a few people. It's everyone who's an active poster, except me.

I don't think people really sit around timing their posts

I don't either, except me, but they did say that they "got the hang of it" after a short time.

maybe it's just the name of their posts

Exactly one of my theories:

I also have a lot more trouble finding the content in the first place, and making creative titles for them. For example "fluffy roll" vs what I could probably come up with "floof" or "very fluffy fox".

The problem is I'm just stupid and a complete mess. I've got nothing together, not even my main goals, and nothing I try works to fix it.

body: That's the reality of everyone, you're just one of the few that admits it. We are biologically hardwired to look after ourselves, and pretending to care about others is one of the techniques used to help ourselves. The only way to do something genuinely good is to do it for the Lord, and even then it's not to your own credit.
body_html: That's the reality of everyone, you're just one of the few that admits it. We are biologically hardwired to look after ourselves, and pretending to care about others is one of the techniques used to help ourselves. The only way to do something genuinely good is to do it for the Lord, and even then it's not to your own credit.

guild.description:
Ask and answer questions.

Rules:

🤔 Posts must be questions. This is a community dedicated to Q&A discussion, so post titles must be in the form of a question.

⁉️ No loaded questions.

📬 No spamming. Spamming comments or posts is not allowed.

😀 Be civil. Be nice. Harassment, trolling, and disruptive behavior is not allowed. Basically, don’t be a jerk.

🥾 Breaking these rules will result in posts being kicked and possibly an exile.

📜 Follow Ruqqus ToS. This is a given.

parent.body:
Honestly, that I'm the nicest person they've ever meet.

I'm actually not very nice at all on the inside, and likely don't care about you beyond a level of keeping you around so I don't have to be constantly bored. I just pretend to be nice to, and care about everyone because it makes life easier for me. Doesn't make me evil, I'm more generous with money and favors than other people are, because it builds a rapport and lets me slide through life without having the friction of personal disagreements making me uncomfortable and burdening me.

I told one of my friends this is how I feel, he doesn't believe it because of how willingly I buy things for my friends.

parent.body:
When in doubt, add "boi", or a lot of cute words like pomf, squee, swish, zoomies, and whatnot 

Maybe get a motion blurred shot of a fox running and title it "fast boi goes zoomies" or something to that effect. The words seem to stimulate the same parts of the brain as cute fox pictures do, I find. People go crazy when you say "birb" or "wiggle boi" instead of "parakeet" for instance.

body:
Actually, those are natural feelings that everyone shares. They just won't dare to admit it, even anonymously. Most people convince themselves that they're good when they're actually evil. Their pride blinds them to the truth about themselves. Over the years they become experts at putting up a good act, but they only do it for their own benefit. People who have even a drop of hope for people as a whole and the good in everyone are living a lie.

If this is still bothering you send me a DM on discord, we have much to discuss.

parent.body:
Agreed, I don't know why people pretend to be so nice and kindhearted. 

But I think I'm different than most. I really don't care about my friends, to the extent that if they died or killed themselves, I'd get over it without much second thought. Hell, sometimes I even find it amusing and funny when people off themselves on video. I couldn't tell you why, and it sounds like I'm being a massive edgelord for attention, but I'm not lying lmao. That's my biggest secret, no one besides a few of my friends will find out, however.

body:
> but practice makes betterment. baby steps ♡

Not for me usually. This for example, I have been doing on purpose for several years, since reddit, and still am barely more able than someone who's never done it before. Yet you and the posters here just started when you came here a few months ago, likely not even "trying" for anything, and have already gotten the hang of it.

Same story yesterday, I have been programming obsessively for *years*, but someone who just started learning a few months ago is already worlds ahead of me and better (and that happens a lot) with less effort. It doesn't matter what I do, I can never get the hang of much of anything.
body_html:
but practice makes betterment. baby steps ♡

Not for me usually. This for example, I have been doing on purpose for several years, since reddit, and still am barely more able than someone who's never done it before. Yet you and the posters here just started when you came here a few months ago, likely not even "trying" for anything, and have already gotten the hang of it.

Same story yesterday, I have been programming obsessively for years, but someone who just started learning a few months ago is already worlds ahead of me and better (and that happens a lot) with less effort. It doesn't matter what I do, I can never get the hang of much of anything.

parent.body:
baby, you're producing cortisol thinking like that, not good! 

not all of my posts, or anyone to be frank, get interactions every time they're posted. you do get good stats on your posts, if that's what you're worried about. Personally, I do see and enjoy all fox pictures you put up, but I don't always remember to upvote (and it's not just your posts that I don't remember to interact with ;<♡)

how about thinking and focusing more on stuff that make you happy (used to make you happy if you're really depressed). from the bottom of my heart, I know how it feels, and i know it's hard, but practice makes betterment. baby steps ♡

parent.body: Crystal dont be so sad and gloomy. You are even making me sad :(
parent.body_html: Crystal dont be so sad and gloomy. You are even making me sad :(

post.body:
I'm not intelligent enough for this site. I was born to be an average sheep who would still be using reddit and watching CNN right now.

I'm only smart because I've thought too much. I became fed up with the establishment early in life and began questioning things. Otherwise I'd have never noticed anything. I also have many interests (and I suck at doing all of them). There's a difference between smart and genius. Smart is what you work for and accumulate over years of work, study, research, and practice. Anyone can become smart, and I'm very smart in many areas. However, I'm definitely not a genius. Genius is what you're born with, talent and intelligence. Geniuses have an instinct or intuition that allows them to start out 10x better at something without trying than the most hard-working non-genius will ever get to. Genius is a whole new level, and it's not available for everyone. Geniuses are naturally smart, and unfortunately as a smart person, especially in an open-source community full of these people, almost everyone I know is a genius. I can't do anything they can do. I'm a tryhard, a wannabe or whatever. My existence here, at least in the early stages of this site, is pointless. I simply didn't inherit the right genes for this type of thing, or most things I want to do. I just wasn't born for it.

Most people here can do anything if they try even a little bit. Most active posters, even brand new ones, easily find 100s of great things in an hour, and super creative titles to go along with some of them. I on the other hand, despite 3 years of experience, can't manage to find more than one or two mediocre things in 2 hours that I haven't seen before. Most active commenters somehow find every single major post in the first 60 seconds and always get the top comments. Most devs here are true programmers, while I'm just a guy who copies and pastes things together and hopes it works. Even non-programmers completely blow me out of the water most of the time. And I've been at this for many years.

My problem is, I know a lot, but I'm dull. I'm the type who can pretend to be gifted, get good grades, etc. But when it really comes down to it, I'm nothing special. For example, you all are the people who can legitimately figure out a complicated math or science problem, whereas I can never do that. I have to be taught literally every step of everything, then I can copy it well enough, but never do it on my own. This is *crucial* for anything I want to accomplish myself; anytime I need to do something that's not been done before, I simply can't. I can't figure anything out. I can only copy others' methods. Yet you all have that genius instinct, to know how to do all these amazing things. I can't do that. I don't belong with you. You are all innovators. I am not, am uncreative, can't think outside the box, a talentless hack, etc. You are the people who make a difference. As for me, my only option is the usual college, job I hate, retire, then die, having nothing to do with my life. Try as I might, no amount of practice or desire will get me the talent I need to accomplish anything for real.

No, I'm not going to delete my account. But I'm not going to try and contribute as much anymore. It's pointless, a waste of time for me to try. You've all got it covered already. I'll just be around as a less active, more normal user.

I have to be taught literally every step of everything, then I can copy it well enough, but never do it on my own. This is crucial for anything I want to accomplish myself; anytime I need to do something that's not been done before, I simply can't. I can't figure anything out. I can only copy others' methods. Yet you all have that genius instinct, to know how to do all these amazing things. I can't do that. I don't belong with you. You are all innovators. I am not, am uncreative, can't think outside the box, a talentless hack, etc. You are the people who make a difference. As for me, my only option is the usual college, job I hate, retire, then die, having nothing to do with my life. Try as I might, no amount of practice or desire will get me the talent I need to accomplish anything for real.

No, I'm not going to delete my account. But I'm not going to try and contribute as much anymore. It's pointless, a waste of time for me to try. You've all got it covered already. I'll just be around as a less active, more normal user.
post.title: I don't belong here

author.bio:
Goodbye. https://ruqqus.com/+The_Cabal/post/d9y9/i-told-you-so-all-the

Remember: History repeats, and the unaware are doomed to repeat it.

guild.description:
The official guild for all things Ruqqus.

Rules:

💻 No promotion of other sites that aren't a fork of Ruqqus

🟪 Ruqqus-related only. This is a community dedicated to Ruqqus meta discussion. Content may involve technology and politics but must have ample context in Ruqqus.

📬 No spamming. Spamming comments or posts is not allowed.

😀 Be civil. Be nice. Harassment, trolling, and disruptive behavior is not allowed. Basically, don’t be a jerk.

📜 Follow Ruqqus ToS. This is a given.

For press releases, visit +RuqqusPress.

For updates and patch notes, visit +changelog.

For ideas and feedback, visit +BetaFeedback

For bug reports, visit +RuqqusBugs
